definition: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) is a web service that provides resizable compute capacity in the cloud. It is designed to make web-scale computing easier for developers.

Amazon S3 is object storage built to store and retrieve any amount of data from anywhere. It's a simple storage service that offers industry leading durability, availability, performance, security, and virtually unlimited scalability at very low costs.
A highly scalable, fast, container management service that makes it easy to run, stop, and manage Docker containers on a cluster of EC2 instances

A fully managed Docker container registry that makes it easy for developers to store, manage, and deploy Docker container images. Amazon ECR is integrated with Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) and AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
A web service that Amazon Web Services (AWS) customers can use to manage users and user permissions within AWS
A service that provides block level storage volumes for use with EC2 instances

A file storage service for EC2 instances. Amazon EFS is easy to use and provides a simple interface with which you can create and configure file systems. Amazon EFS storage capacity grows and shrinks automatically as you add and remove files
A managed service that simplifies running Kubernetes on AWS without your needing to stand up or maintain your own Kubernetes control plane
A web service that applications, users, and devices can use to instantly send and receive notifications from the cloud
Reliable and scalable hosted queues for storing messages as they travel between computers
An infrastructure web services platform in the cloud for companies of all sizes

A distinct location within a Region that's insulated from failures in other Availability Zones, and provides inexpensive, low-latency network connectivity to other Availability Zones in the same Region
An open-source software development framework for defining your cloud infrastructure in code and provisioning it through AWS CloudFormation

A document that defines who can access a particular bucket or object. Each bucket and object in Amazon S3 has an ACL. The document defines what each type of user can do, such as write and read permissions

An encrypted machine image stored in Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) or Amazon Simple Storage Service. AMIs function similar to a template of a computer's root drive. They contain the operating system and can also include software and layers of your application, such as database servers, middleware, and web servers

A web service for provisioning a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud virtual network that you define. You control your virtual networking environment, including selection of your own IP address range, creation of subnets, and configuration of route tables and network gateways
A representation of multiple EC2 instances that share similar characteristics, and that are treated as a logical grouping for the purposes of instance scaling and management

A web service that speeds up distribution of your static and dynamic web content—such as .html, .css, .js, media files, and image files—to your users by using a worldwide network of data centers. When a user requests your content, the request is routed to the data center that provides the lowest latency (time delay). If the content is already in the location with the lowest latency, the CDN delivers it immediately. If not, the CDN retrieves it from an origin that you specify (for example, a web server or an Amazon S3 bucket). With some CDNs, you can help secure your content by configuring an HTTPS connection between users and data centers, and between data centers and your origin. Amazon CloudFront is an example of a CDN.
A unified downloadable and configurable tool for managing AWS services. Control multiple AWS services from the command line and automate them through scripts.
The strategies and technologies used by enterprises for the data analysis of business information
A fully managed ledger database that provides a transparent, immutable, and cryptographically verifiable transaction log ‎owned by a central trusted authority
A web service that can help you migrate data to and from many widely used commercial and open-source databases

A process that's used to integrate data from multiple sources. Data is collected from sources (extract), converted to an appropriate format (transform), and written to a target data store (load) for purposes of analysis and querying. AWS Glue is an ETL service
a fully managed, highly available, in-memory cache for Amazon DynamoDB that delivers up to a 10 times performance improvement
The average amount of time that has passed between incidents
The average amount of time it takes to recover from an incident
The maximum time it should take to restore to normal operations following an outage or data loss

The maximum amount of data an organisation can tolerate losing; measured in time from the moment a failure occurs to the last backup. i.e. if a failure occurs and the last backup was 24 hours ago, the RPO is 24 hours

The AWS Cost and Usage Reports (AWS CUR) contains the most comprehensive set of cost and usage data available. You can use Cost and Usage Reports to publish your AWS billing reports to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket that you own. You can receive reports that break down your costs by the hour, day, or month, by product or product resource, or by tags that you define yourself. AWS updates the report in your bucket once a day in comma-separated value (CSV) format. You can view the reports using spreadsheet software such as Microsoft Excel or Apache OpenOffice Calc, or access them from an application using the Amazon S3 API
A performance measure used to evaluate the efficiency or profitability of an investment or compare the efficiency of a number of different investments

CFM solutions help transform your business through cost transparency, control, forecasting, and optimization. These solutions can also help enable a cost-conscious culture that drives accountability across all teams and functions. Finance teams can see where costs are coming from, run operations with minimal unexpected expenses, plan for dynamic cloud usage, and save on cloud expenses while teams scale their adoptions on the cloud. Sharing this with engineering teams can provide necessary financial context for their resource selection, use, and optimization.

expansions: Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka
definition: A fully managed service that enables you to build and run applications that use Apache Kafka to process streaming data
In DynamoDB, you can create a global secondary index any time after creating a base table. In a global secondary index, the partition and hash keys can be different than the base table
In DynamoDB, you can create a global secondary index at table creation time
Type of transaction used by Amazon QLDB. Data storage systems that apply these are called transactional systems
Service used to generate tokens for IAM roles

SAML enables you to access multiple web applications using one set of login credentials. It works by passing authentication information in a particular format between two parties, usually an identity provider (idP) and a web application
A service that stores and verifies user identity. IdPs are typically cloud-hosted services, and they often work with single sign-on (SSO) providers to authenticate users
A session and user authentication service that permits a user to use one set of login credentials for multiple services
Subnet level firewall
EC2 instance level firewall
EC2 instance level firewall
EC2 instance level firewall
EC2 instance level firewall
EC2 instance level firewall
Provides a framework and implementation for encryption, key generation and key agreement, and Message Authentication Code (MAC) algorithms

Designed by Microsoft and intended for use by developers of applications that will enable users to create and exchange documents and other data in a secure environment, especially over non-secure media such as the Internet
An encrypted tunnel through the internet connecting two devices or networks
An AWS service that allows you to share resources between accounts
AWS service for creating and managing cryptographic keys
